Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division

did.head: Collection Summary

descriptivenote.p: Collection material in English and German

did.abstract: Neurologist, psychoanalyst, and educator. Correspondence, letterbooks, notebooks, genealogical material, biographical material, scrapbooks, photographs, articles, sketches, studies, newspaper clippings, memorabilia, and a diary relating primarily to Jelliffe’s career and to his family.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

persname.part: Jelliffe, Helena Dewey Leeming, -1916. Correspondence and diary.
Lewis, Nolan D. C. (Nolan Don Carpentier), 1889-1979--Correspondence.

title.part: Journal of nervous and mental disease.
Nervous and mental disease monograph series.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Smith Ely Jelliffe, neurologist, psychoanalyst, and educator, were given to the Library of Congress by Arcangelo D’Amore and Nolan D. C. Lewis in 1976. Mr. and Mrs. Carel Goldschmidt deposited items in 1978, and Mrs. Goldschmidt gave additional material in 1981. The deposit was converted to a gift in 1979. Additional material was given by Robert Stragnell in 2001.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The papers of Smith Ely Jelliffe were housed and listed circa 1981. The collection was expanded and partially reprocessed in 2010. The collection and finding aid were revised in 2011

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: Part of the Jelliffe Papers are described in The Quarterly Journal of the Library of Congress 34, no. 4 (Oct. 1977): 360-363, 374.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Copyright in the unpublished writings of Smith Ely Jelliffe in these papers and in other collections of papers in the custody of the Library of Congress has been dedicated to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Smith Ely Jelliffe are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Smith Ely Jelliffe Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Graduated, Brooklyn Polytechnic Institute, Brooklyn, N.Y.
Ph.D., College of Physicians and Surgeons, Columbia University, New York, N.Y.
Associate editor, Journal of Nervous and Mental Diseases ; managing editor and owner, 1902-1945
Clinical professor of Mental Diseases, Fordham University, New York, N.Y.

chronitemset.event: Published with William A. White, The Modern Treatment of Nervous and Mental Diseases . Philadelphia, Pa.: Lea & Febiger
Founded with William A. White, Psychoanalytic Review , the first English-language publication dedicated to psychoanalysis

chronitem.event: Published with William A. White, Diseases of the Nervous System: A Text-Book of Neurology and Psychiatry . Philadelphia, Pa.: Lea & Febiger
Published The Technique of Psychoanalysis . New York: Nervous and Mental Disease Publication Co., the first book devoted to analytical technique
Presided over session of July 21, third Conférence des Psychanalystes de Langue Française, Paris, France
Published Sketches in Psychosomatic Medicine . New York: Nervous and Mental Disease Monographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p:
The papers of Smith Ely Jelliffe (1866-1945) span the years 1882-1977, with the bulk dating from 1885 to 1944. The papers are organized into the following series: Correspondence, Notes, Genealogical Material, Biographical Material, Scrapbooks,
Miscellany, Memorabilia, Addition, and Oversize.

Jelliffe is often credited as one of the founders of American psychosomatic medicine. He was, however, more widely known for his translations of numerous European works in neurology, psychiatry, psychopathology, and psychotherapy, and the serials he owned and edited, Journal of Nervous and Mental Disease, Psychoanalytic Review, and Nervous and Mental Disease Monograph.

The Correspondence series relates primarily to Jelliffe’s career and includes correspondents such as Eugen Bleuler, A. A. Brill, M. Eitingon, Havelock Ellis, Paul Federn, Otto Fenichel, Sándor Ferenczi, Sigmund Freud, G. Stanley Hall, Ernest Jones, C. G. Jung, Emil Kraepelin, René Laforgue, Nolan D. C. Lewis, Karl A. Menninger, Adolf Meyer, Sandor Rado, Otto Rank, Wilhelm Reich, Theodor Reik, Paul Schilder, Wilhelm Stekel, and William A. White. Also of interest is correspondence with botanists and letters received while in Germany in 1891. The letters and letterbooks are largely Jelliffe’s correspondence to and from his wife, Helena (“Lelie”) Dewey Leeming Jelliffe, daughter Helena Woodruff Jelliffe Goldschmidt, and sister Louise (“Lulu”) Jelliffe Long.

The Notes contain journals, notebooks, a study of Huntington’s chorea, lecture notes, and notes on articles concerning dementia praecox and other mental illnesses, all including many hand-drawn illustrations. Additional material related to the articles is found in the Miscellany series along with photographs, sketches by Jelliffe, and newspaper clippings.

The Genealogical Material and Biographical Material series contain notebooks of background information collected on various Jelliffe ancestors as well as autobiographical material on Jelliffe and correspondence from later years concerning genealogy. Photographs are also included in the Biographical Material.

The Scrapbooks and Memorabilia series consist of bound volumes containing correspondence, photographs, printed ephemera, newspaper clippings, and plant material. The scrapbooks relate to European trips. Also in Memorabilia are printed matter and diplomas.

The Addition contains a diary of Helena Dewey Leeming Jelliffe and a notebook of Jelliffe’s general observations. The general correspondence in the Addition was written mostly to and from family members including Jelliffe’s first wife, Helena Dewey Leeming Jelliffe; their daughters, Winifred Jelliffe Emerson, Helena Woodruff Jelliffe Goldschmidt, and Sylvia Canfield Jelliffe Stragnell; his sister Louise (“Lulu”) Jelliffe Long; brothers-in-law Thomas Lonsdale Leeming and Joseph Leeming; and second wife, Belinda (“Bee”) Jelliffe; as well as family friends. Included also is a scrapbook from a trip to Alaska in 1905 containing printed ephemera and plant material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in nine series:

scopecontent.p: Letters, letterbooks, a notebook, and miscellaneous correspondence interspersed with photographs and illustrations.

arrangement.p: Arranged by type of material with the miscellaneous correspondence arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: To Helena (“Lelie”) Dewey Leeming Jelliffe (wife), pages 1-298, 1890-1891
To Helena Dewey Leeming Jelliffe, pages 299-548, 1891-1893
Schuendener’s Laboratory, Berlin, Germany, notebook and letters, 1891; and letters from Helena Dewey Leeming Jelliffe and Helena Woodruff Jelliffe Goldschmidt (daughter), 1908-1910
To Helena Woodruff Jelliffe Goldschmidt and Louise (“Lulu”) Jelliffe Long (sister), 1925-1944
With J. B. Lippincott Co. and Lea Brothers & Co., 1900-1903
Scrapbook of letters with photographs and clippings, 1935-1943

scopecontent.p: Notebooks, journals, articles, and a lecture.

arrangement.p: Arranged by type of material or title of article.

did.unittitle:
Study of Huntington’s chorea in families,
undated
Botany notes, vols. I-V and IX, 1886

scopecontent.p: Notebooks on Jelliffe family interspersed with photographs and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Jelliffe, Thomas, land transfers made by, vol. II

scopecontent.p: Autobiographical notes and typescript, photographs, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Autobiographical notes and typescript, and photographs, undated

scopecontent.p: Bound volumes containing correspondence, newspaper clippings, photographs, and printed ephemera kept by the Jelliffe family relating to European trips.
Family photographs, sketches by Jelliffe, articles, and newspaper clippings.

did.unittitle: Class picture, other photographs, and negatives of Jelliffe

scopecontent.p: Bound volumes containing newspaper clippings, photographs, plant material, printed ephemera, and correspondence.

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically as received with miscellaneous items at the end.
Arranged alphabetically by type of material.
Arranged and described according to the series, container, and folder from which the items were removed.
